definition: to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: These booms are to stop the traffic for passing trains.
sentences.chinese: 這些吊杆是用來爲過路火車通過而攔住交通的。

sentences.english: Outside Leo Mugabe, President of Zimbabwe's association buttonholed me.
sentences.chinese: 津巴布韋足協主席萊奧穆加貝在外面攔住我。

sentences.english: I caught Mr. Gesell at last, when he was airing the dog.
sentences.chinese: 我終於在格塞爾先生遛狗的時候攔住了他。

sentences.english: You stopped my train because of this?
sentences.chinese: 你們攔住我的火車就爲這事？

sentences.english: They built a dam along the seashore to retain the seawater.
sentences.chinese: 他們沿海岸築起一道堤壩以攔住海水。

sentences.english: Hehad run out of the room before I could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒來得及攔住他，他就跑出了屋子。

sentences.english: He had rushed out before I could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒來得及攔住他他就衝出去了。

sentences.english: But my mother dissuaded her once more.
She linger outside the theater to waylay him after the show.
sentences.chinese: 徘徊想在演出之後攔住他說話。

sentences.english: The constable stopped a speeding driver.
sentences.chinese: 警察攔住了一個超速行駛的司機。

sentences.english: We stopped the pudgy kid in the middle of the sidewalk and surrounded him.
sentences.chinese: 我們在人行道中間攔住了那個矮胖小子。

sentences.english: I tried to stop him coming through the door but he just barged in.
sentences.chinese: 我想攔住他，不讓他進門，可是他硬闖進來。

sentences.english: There they were intercepted by our fighters and a furious battle commenced.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏它們被我軍的戰鬥機攔住了，激戰開始了。

sentences.english: He was stopped by the doorkeeper as soon as he entered.
sentences.chinese: 他剛一進大門，就被門衛給攔住了。

sentences.english: A barrage would halt the flow upstream and lift the water level.
sentences.chinese: 一道攔河壩將會在上游攔住水流，擡升水位。

sentences.english: The police headed an overspeed car.
sentences.chinese: 警察攔住了一輛超速行駛的汽車。
